questions.text: David Carroll originated the role of Baron Felix von Gaigern, but who can be heard singing the role on the cast recording?
questions.explanation:
Brent Barrett.

	David Carroll died of AIDS during the recording session, so Brent Barrett was brought in to sing the role.

questions.text: "We'll Take a Glass Together" is sung by which two characters as well as the ensemble?
options: Otto Kringelein and Colonel Doctor Otternschlag
questions.explanation:
The Baron and Otto Kringelein.

	Michael Jeter played Otto, the abookkeeper who is determined to live it up while he still can. Jeter has also been seen in "The Green Mile" with Tom Hanks. He played Edouard Delacroix.

questions.text: Which cast member had appeared onstage with Jeff Goldblum in 1981?
questions.explanation:
Timothy Jerome.

	Jerome and Goldblum appeared together in "The Moony Shapiro Songbook", one of those rare shows that opened and closed on the same night! Also in the cast was Gary Beach, who later played Roger de Bris in "The Producers".

questions.text: Whom does Preysing shoot and kill?
questions.explanation:
The Baron.

	Baron Felix is low on money, and steals Preysing's wallet. Preysing catches him in the act and shoots him, fatally wounding him. Preysing is later arrested, and nobody believes that a baron would steal a wallet!

questions.text: Whom does Otto dance with in "Who Couldn't Dance With You?"
questions.explanation:
Flaemmchen.

	At the Baron's urging, Flaemmchen, the typist, dances with Otto, the terminally ill bookkeeper. The Baron and Otto develop a great friendship throughout the show, although the Baron originally intends only to swindle him out of money.

questions.text: As Preysing is hauled off to jail, what is his request?
questions.correct: He wants to wash his hands
options: He wants to say goodbye to Raffaela
He wants to call a lawyer
He wants to call his wife
questions.explanation:
He wants to wash his hands.

	Preysing is arrested for the murder of the Baron, whom he shot for stealing his wallet. Mortally wounded, the Baron sings "Roses at the Station".

questions.text: Which character is a new father by the end of the show?
questions.explanation:
Erik.

	Bob Stillman originated the role of Erik, the front desk receptionist who learns at the end of the show that his pregnant wife has given birth. Stillman has also been seen in "Grey Gardens" and his music was featured in "Urban Cowboy".

questions.text: Complete this lyric from "As It Should Be": "Dangerous games and a ___________ existence."
questions.explanation:
carefree.

	The Baron sings of his need for adventure at the beginning of the show. Little does he know that his risky behavior will have serious consequences.

Raffaela.

	Raffaela is Elizaveta Grushinskaya's companion who secretly harbors an unrequited love for her. Grushinskaya is an aging ballerina on her farewell tour who falls in love with the younger Baron.

questions.text: Which character wants to go to Hollywood?
questions.explanation:
Flaemmchen.

	Flaemmchen is a typist, but is told she has the looks to go to Hollywood. A lecherous Preysing tries to proposition her, but she resists. At the end of the show she goes to Paris with Otto Kringelein.
